data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
This module provides an object-oriented interface to the online
    dictionary at http://dict.leo.org. I've called it WWW::LEO, as its
    purpose fits in the row of WWW::* modules (modules that interface to
    web sites of various sorts), where the term LEO identifies the
    "target site". (LEO is an acronym for "Link Everyting Online".)

    I believe that the module should be listed in the module list, as
    it is probably quite useful for a broader audience, especially for
    Germans. (LEO is well-known around there, so the name should suggest
    the dictionary type purpose of the module.)
